subject: Welcome to Scoro – here's how to get started!
body:
We’re excited to help you start saving time and structuring your daily work. Here are some resources to get you started.
 
 
Hi Jorgelina,
We’re excited to help you start saving time and structuring your daily work! Here are some resources to get you started:
 
Choose a structured learning path with our Getting Started Guide
We have dedicated an entire 
Help Center
 section to new Scoro users, packed with beginner GIF guides and videos. There are two learning paths you can choose based on your day-to-day responsibilities:
Admins & Champion Users
: onboarding materials for users who need to know Scoro inside out, such as site admins, executives, project managers, etc.
All Users
: guidance for all Scoro users who track and manage their time and tasks in Scoro.
Get answers from ELI Chat without leaving your site
Next to the 
Help
 button in Scoro, you'll find 
ELI
, our AI-powered virtual assistant. You can use it as your personal Scoro expert, letting you get answers to your questions about Scoro without leaving your site. ELI is connected to Scoro's Help Center, so it knows everything that's there and can help you with simple Scoro-related questions.
 
Learn on the go with the Help Station
 
If you prefer to browse around the product and learn hands-on, you will find relevant articles, tours and quick video tips in the 
Help Station
. The Help Station is dynamic–it always offers resources relevant to the exact view you’re currently in. This saves you the trouble of having to do your own digging.
To access Help Station, click the 
Help 
button in the top-right corner of your site.
 
Scoro Blog & Events
Keep an eye on our 
blog
 and 
events page
 to stay in the loop with exciting work management and productivity insights.
The Handbook Podcast & Newsletter
Listen to our 
podcast The Handbook
 by Harv Nagra, an Ops Consultancy and Ex-Agency Leader, as he discusses the behind-the-scenes of agency operations and the latest trends and innovations with operations experts. Subscribe to our 
newsletter
 to get the latest info on agency challenges and solutions delivered directly to your inbox.
Scoro Referral Program
If you're enjoying Scoro and know someone else who would find it useful, join our 
referral program
! You can earn up to 1,800 USD per every referral that becomes a Scoro customer.
Go to your site
 
Here's to working smarter!
Team Scoro
Save your login details:
Your site: 
https://lcw.scoro.com
Username: j.venturi@lcwmail.com
Looking for more resources?
Help Center
 
|
 
Webinars
 | 
Product Updates
 | 
Pricing
 
 
 
 
Scoro Software, 9th Floor, 107 Cheapside, London, England EC2V 6DN, United Kingdom 
Unsubscribe

Subject:
 Farewell Catalina & Welcome Jorgelina (Lina) - Translation Coordinator
 
Hi all,
 
While it's Larry's last day today, it's also Catalina's last day 
🙁
. I know everyone who has worked with Catalina knows how great she is. She will be sorely missed! 
 
The good news is that Catalina has helped us find her replacement - Jorgelina's (Lina). Lina is just as amazing as Catalina, and I know you will enjoy working with her. Lina has started, is based in Argentina, & will be training with Catalina to get up to speed. Lina will also be joining our all-staff meeting on Tuesday. Please reach out to her for a warm welcome! 
 
Welcome Lina!

Subject:
 Congrats Chuck on 5 years at LCW!
 
I know...a lot of emails today - but it's been a busy day! 
🙂
 
Feb.16 marks Chuck's 5-year work anniversary at LCW. 
In the past half-decade, Chuck has guided LCW (and us) with wisdom, vision, and an impressive vocabulary that keeps us all reaching for a dictionary. His strategic thinking, dedication, and ability to inspire have made a lasting impact on our team and the work we do.
Please join us in congratulating Chuck on this milestone! Congrats Chuck! 
🎉
Cheers,
Nicole

Subject:
 Farewell Catalina & Welcome Jorgelina (Lina) - Translation Coordinator
 
Hi all,
 
While it's Larry's last day today, it's also Catalina's last day 
🙁
. I know everyone who has worked with Catalina knows how great she is. She will be sorely missed! 
 
The good news is that Catalina has helped us find her replacement - Jorgelina's (Lina). Lina is just as amazing as Catalina, and I know you will enjoy working with her. Lina has started, is based in Argentina, & will be training with Catalina to get up to speed. Lina will also be joining our all-staff meeting on Tuesday. Please reach out to her for a warm welcome! 
 
Welcome Lina!
 
 
Nicole Barile

subject: RE: Onboarding
body:
Hello ladies, 
Welcome Jor!!
Here my answers:
Will
 you introduce Lina to clients, or will Lina do it herself? Either works for me. I just want to make sure clients know their new contact at LCW. 
I’ll do it this week with her in cc.
What is our average turnaround time for translating a "Consulting/DEI" EL or ML into another language? 
. It’s hard to tell, it will depend if we update or do it from scratch. If we have to do voiceover and subtitles of the videos or not. All have been update except Colgate which we built from scratch. Dustin most of the time takes 1 week to update the E        nglish. Then we translate which may take a week. If we need voiceover and subtitle add it 10 days. Then a full week of QA and finalization. So average I would say a month.
You mentioned you use someone (instead of Keri) to help with the formatting of documents once translated. Who is this person & how much do they charge? 
Veronica Mattalia 
v.mattalia.dtp@gmail.com
 $20 the hour. We have an  excel sheet in DB where we have all their info, rates and which ones we use. I’ll show it to Jor.
I will keep your Dropbox, Scoro, and Outlook access through next Wed, Feb.19th. LMK if this works for you. I assume you might need access to show Lina things, but if you don't, LMK, and I can cancel all that sooner. Definitely! I’ll keep you updated and our training and handover. I think a week will be enough.
I’ll also miss working with you Nicole, you’re awesome! But Im very happy Lina joins the team, I know you too will get along and the team will love her.
I’ll still be around at least for a week. Will send to everyone my final farewell by then with personal info 
😊
Kindly,
CDS
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Subject:
 Onboarding
 
Hi Lina! 
🙂
 
Thanks for your time today. Attached is the PPT we looked at.
I've also attached a manual that has a lot of info around your role. 
@Catalina De Sanctis
 - I assume a lot of this is out of date. I will let you decide with Lina if this doc is worth using at all.
 
Call Summary:
Lina has an LCW email
You can use Outlook web app (
Office365
) or download the app
Lina has been added to Dropbox. Once she accepts, I will add her to the appropriate folders & create a "Side Projects" folder so she can add her timesheet there. 
@Catalina De Sanctis
 will show her how to use Dropbox for her role
You can use the web app (
https://www.dropbox.com/
) or download the app
Lina has been added to Scoro.
@Catalina De Sanctis
 will show her how to use it for her role
Scoro access: 
https://lcw.scoro.com/
 - we use the web version; there's no app to download
Meetings
Lina has been added to the all staff meeting invite - you can intro yourself. I'll share with the team you have joined LCW & will be on the call.
Lina & Nicole have 2 scheduled 1:1s for the first two weeks; we can adjust this in the future.
Questions / Comments for 
@Catalina De Sanctis
Will
 you introduce Lina to clients, or will Lina do it herself? Either works for me. I just want to make sure clients know their new contact at LCW.
What is our average turnaround time for translating a "Consulting/DEI" EL or ML into another language?
You mentioned you use someone (instead of Keri) to help with the formatting of documents once translated. Who is this person & how much do they charge?
I will keep your Dropbox, Scoro, and Outlook access through next Wed, Feb.19th. LMK if this works for you. I assume you might need access to show Lina things, but if you don't, LMK, and I can cancel all that sooner.
Both of you - please LMK if I'm missing anything important and/or if you have questions or need anything at all.
 
Looking forward to working with you Lina. And I'll miss working with you Catalina! Send your personal contact info when you get a chance.
 
Thank you!
Nicole
